description.narrative: The long-term overall goal of the proposed project is to support the government in the implementation of the Strategy for the Development of Pre-University Education in Kosovo and the Strategy for the Development of Higher Education. The specific objective of the proposed project is to strengthen systems, institutions and management capacities needed for education quality improvements.

condition.narrative: A Project Operational Manual (POM) acceptable to IDA, shall be adopted by the MEST

title.narrative: 60 percent of municipalities are able to report using EMIS data on the status of dropout and retention disaggregated by gender and community by 2012.

comment.narrative: Original indicator and targets revised as per Level Two Restructuring approved on 16-Nov-2011.

actual.value: 80% of municipalities were able to report on status of drop-out and retention, disaggregated by gender, using EMIS data.

comment.narrative: Indicator met.

title.narrative:  The availability of school mapping, and costed investment plan and maintenance guidelines for school facilities by December 2011.

comment.narrative: Original indicator and targets revised as per Level Two Restructuring approved on 16-Nov-2011.

target.value: preperation in 2009 and 2010; preparation of investment plan and maintenance guidelines by 2011; implementation by 2012.

actual.value: The investment plan and maintenance guidelines are finalized and approved by MEST.

comment.narrative: Indicator met.

title.narrative: The number of municipalities which allocate recurrent budget to schools according to funding formula.

comment.narrative: Original indicator and targets revised as per Level Two Restructuring approved on 16-Nov-2011.

target.value: 0 by 2008; 3 by 2009; 13 by 2010 and 2011; nationwide (37) by 2012

actual.value: The Government piloted the funding formula in 13 municipalities in 2010 and continued the implementation in 2011. The reform waslaunched at national level in 2012.

comment.narrative: Indicator met.

title.narrative: The Council for Teacher Licensing is established, and teacher licensing, professional development and performance evaluation systems are in place by project closing date.

comment.narrative: Original indicator and targets revised as per Level Two Restructuring approved on 16-Nov-2011.

target.value: established by 2009; functional by 2010; functional by 2011 and 2012.

actual.value: The Ministry reestablished the Teacher Licensing Council. The Licensing System, Professional Development and PerformanceEvaluationsystem will be operationalized in 2012.

comment.narrative: Indicator met.

title.narrative: Number of schools implementing SDGs which are able to establish quality improvement indicators at school level and monitor them

comment.narrative: Original indicator and targets revised as per Level Two Restructuring approved on 16-Nov-2011.

actual.value: 307 schools were able to establish improvement indicators at school level.

comment.narrative: Indicator partially met.

title.narrative: % of teachers who have completed the minimum in-service training requirements.

comment.narrative: Original indicator and targets revised as per Level Two Restructuring approved on 16-Nov-2011.
Indicator on track. The percentage of teachers that have completed the minimum in-service training will be known with thecompletion of the Teacher Licensing database by end November 2012.

title.narrative: MEST establishes baseline of assessment and examination instruments to measure the student learning outcomes at grade 5 by 2010.

comment.narrative: Original indicator and targets revised as per Level Two Restructuring approved on 16-Nov-2011.

target.value: Instrument finalized by 2009; baseline established by 2010 and analysis prepared by 2011

actual.value: The instruments developed for Grade 5 assessment are in place, and are being used for Grade 9 as well.

comment.narrative: Indicator met.

title.narrative: Development of new school construction design standards.

comment.narrative: Original indicator and targets revised as per Level Two Restructuring approved on 16-Nov-2011.

target.value: prepraration in 2009 and 2010; finalized in 2011; formaly adopted in 2012

actual.value: The Manual finalized and endorsed by MEST in July 2011.

comment.narrative: Indicator met.

title.narrative: A primary and secondary education law which clarifies roles and responsibilities for delivery of education among various levels of education system is adopted by the Parliament by June 2011.

comment.narrative: Original indicator and targets revised as per Level Two Restructuring approved on 16-Nov-2011.

target.value: reviewed and amended by 2010; adopted by 2011; implemented by 2012;

comment.narrative: Indicator met.

title.narrative: 60 percent of schools receiving school development grants produce school improvement plans and monitoring reports by 2011.

comment.narrative: Original indicator revised as per Level Two Restructuring approved on 16-Nov-2011.

actual.value: The first and second round of School Development Grants (SDGs) has been completed. The third round is to becompleted by December2012. All schools have been able to produce school development plans.

comment.narrative: Indicator is on track.

title.narrative: Number of additional qualified primary teachers resulting from project interventions.

comment.narrative: The project tracks the number of teachers with a regular teaching license. To get a regular teaching license teachers have to havea university degree, pedagogical training, and have completed an inception period as beginner teachers. Regular licenses arerenewedevery 5 years on the basis of in-service training taken and performance evaluation.

Indicator partially met.The Project has supported MEST in developing the framework and necessary by-laws for teacher promotion,i.e., requirements for teacher professional development and procedures for performance appraisal. The number above reflects thenumberof teachers certified as qualified teachers, i.e. having the appropriate pre-service training to teach at a certain level ofeducation system.

title.narrative: The availability and quality of annual EMIS report, consisting of statistics and analysis of education trends.

target.value: upgrade EMIS Software by 2010; Data collection through software and improvements on quality of reports by 2011; reportdissemination by 2012.

comment.narrative: Targets revised as per Level Two Restructuring approved on 16-Nov-2011.

actual.value: The modules for the existing EMIS have been modified. MEST is working on improving the analysis of educational trends based on thereports produced.

comment.narrative: Indicator on track.

title.narrative: Timely preparation/ revision of per capita funding formula that will direct resources to areas of need, and its implementation.

baseline.value: The central government introduced a formula-funding to municipalities in 2002/03, which became operational in 2005. Yet theformula needs improvement. Municipality-to-school budget allocation remained untransparent and inefficient.

target.value: revised by 2008; implemented by 2009; reviewed by 2011

comment.narrative: Targets revised as per Level Two Restructuring approved on 16-Nov-2011.
Indicator met.

title.narrative: The Law on Higher Education is amended and adopted.

baseline.value: There is a law on higher education, but needs a revision in light of higher education reform agenda.

target.value: A new higher education law is adoped by 2010.

comment.narrative: Targets revised as per Level Two Restructuring approved on 16-Nov-2011.
Indicator met.

title.narrative: The study on the size and shpae of higher education in Kosovo is used by MEST to develop a concrete strategy which proposes a cost-effective expansion of the system.

baseline.value: There is no higher education financing strategy.

target.value: A higher education financing strategy backed with budget projections is adopted by 2010.

actual.value: The recommendations of the study are incorporated in the Higher Education part of the Education Sector Strategy approved in 2011.

comment.narrative: Indicator met.

title.narrative: MEST/MFE monitors and publishes recurrent expenditure each year.

target.value: report produced by 2008; report disseminated annually from 2009 through2012

actual.value: The yearly expenditures reports are published by MoF.

comment.narrative: Indicator met.

title.narrative: System for learning assessment at the primary level

comment.narrative: Indicator met.(This is an OPCS core indicator.)

title.narrative: % of teachers licensed as regular teacher.

comment.narrative: Indicator met.
